parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lake. Probably from limen; a pond.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fisherman. From hals; a sailor, i.e. a fisher.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and the base of basis; literally, to disembark; figuratively, to eventuate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To wash. A prolonged form of an obsolete pluo; to 'plunge', i.e. Launder clothing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fishing-net. Probably from a primary verb diko; a seine.
